file_content.text: I'm heading for the Voidwolf's flagship now.
That's the only good news I've heard in weeks.
Send me the coordinates, and I'll try to get you backup.
I was kind of hoping for "The Republic will take it from here."
You'll "try"?
And in the meantime, full speed ahead?
What do you want me to do?
We've got over a hundred major offensives around the galaxy, Captain. If you wait until we've got troops free, it'll be too late.
This one is yours.
After what he did to me, I'll take the Voidwolf down myself.
I don't need backup.
That sounds a lot like revenge, Captain. You may not want to say that to a Jedi.
Shh. Jedi don't like r-e-v-e-n-g-e.
Your gun. My hand.
Don't your Jedi tell people that revenge leads to the dark side?
See, that's the kind of thing I always got wrong in my Jedi trials....
Stop the Voidwolf, Captain, and the Republic will recognize you as one of its greatest heroes.
And I will deal with anyone who questions your methods.
The SIS tells me there is no way Councillor Caicos could have left that house.
We're still recovering from Coruscant. If the Voidwolf strikes our shipyards, it'll cripple the navy. They could invade the Core Worlds!
You need to find out where the Voidwolf is now.
Any idea where a certain corrupt Corellian councillor may be hiding?
Dodonna said to find Caicos.
Ah, yes.
I'm yours to command.
Define "need." I need money....
Is this a paying job?
Of course. The Republic has already approved an award for apprehending Darmas and Dodonna.
Of course. Let me transfer your reward for apprehending Senator Dodonna.
Of course. Let me transfer your reward for apprehending Darmas Pollaran.
Of course. It's unfortunate neither Darmas nor Dodonna survived for you to collect on those rewards. But here's a small honorarium for what you found.
Dodonna indicated that Councillor Caicos is the only one on Corellia who has in-person contact with the Voidwolf.
It seems from your transmission that Councillor Caicos is one of the few people who has in-person contact with the Voidwolf.
You should be able to get coordinates for the Voidwolf's flagship from him, maybe even piggyback onto the next rendezvous they've planned.
Are you talking about face-to-face or poking around in his underwear drawer when he's not home?
Confront him or sneak around?
Oh, he's home. The whole Corellian council has been holed up since the news came out of their betrayal.
I can even give you the SIS file on his residence, but you'll need to find your own way in.
Do you know where I can find Caicos?
Where should I go?
If Caicos tries to get between me and the Voidwolf, he's going down too.
Nothing will stop me.
The SIS has files on the entire Corellian council. I can send you the address and security specs for Caicos's residence.
But he was paranoid even before the war.
The entire perimeter of his estate is lined with cameras and sensors. You'll have to destroy them all to get in unnoticed.
Anything else, oh Mistress of Breaking and Entering?
You know a lot for a Jedi.
Let's just assume that anything Risha knows how to do, I know how to do.
Careful he doesn't take that the wrong way, Sumalee.
The captain's still trying to figure me out, Sumalee.
You're not like most Jedi, are you?
Haha!
You're very open-minded. For a Jedi.
Where were you when I was at the Jedi Academy?
Not a problem.
You don't think he'll be worried if all his cameras die at once?
That's "unnoticed"?
At least he won't be able to tell the Voidwolf it's you.
Once you're past the perimeter, every entrance is equipped with neural scanners that only admit certain brainwave signatures.
If you're not with someone authorized, the house will fry you.
The scanners won't notice if the authorized user has a blaster to the forehead, right?
I'll get a guard to let me in.
As long as you don't pull the trigger.
You've been full of surprising ideas. Got any for this one?
Any suggestions?
Never been killed by a home security system yet.
I'm not worried.
This is military-spec hardware. Don't taunt it.
Perhaps you could... gently persuade... one of his guards to accompany you.
Any further discussion might leave me ethically compromised.
Good luck, Captain. Call me before you take on the Voidwolf; that's not something you should do alone.
The Voidwolf has his own fleet, and he's going after Republic shipyards!
That's exactly what Dodonna just confirmed. She begged me to send you against the Voidwolf personally.
How did you--? You found Dodonna? Did she give you anything?
I need recordings, written communications-- wait! Is this Dodonna and the Voidwolf talking?
Clear the tunnels. Curske will meet you at the entrance.
I'll send back the coordinates for one of our safe houses. Make sure no one is following, then meet me there.
I don't know what the Republic would do without you.
Darmas is dead. I have his file on Dodonna.
I am going to preserve our good working relationship by assuming he shot first.
I turned Darmas over to the Republic forces. I have his dossier on Dodonna.
Excellent. I'll have him kept under guard, in isolation.
I have Darmas's evidence against Dodonna.
This line is secure. Transmit anything he gave you.
Draw out the Imperial troops. I will make sure you're covered going in.
Caicos was one of the councillors who opened the doors to the Empire. Imperial troops are using his factory as a field hospital.
Maybe I should send Darmas some flowers....
You think they fled there?
If they're turning our droids against us, why hasn't the Republic cut them off?
An easy target.
I'm not part of your army. I'm just after Darmas.
Who cares?
If Darmas Pollaran retreated with the Imperial troops, that's where he'll be.
We've been trying to blow through the Caicos factory, but they've got it surrounded like you wouldn't believe.
We've planted a doctor on the inside, but he hasn't found any weakness in their defense.
There's got to be an access point. Sewage pipe? Medical waste shipment?
I'll find a way in.
It's soldiers out and casualties back in. Nothing else with a heartbeat.
But if we convince them they're under attack... enough to send all their forces out at once....
If there's too many soldiers inside, they just need a good reason to come out....
We can draw out their troops.
Stage a big enough attack and no one will notice one man sneaking in.
Do you have enough men to cover the captain while he goes in?
Attack and they will defend their base.
Imperial troops are predictable. The whole unit will rush to a point of attack. They don't hold back reserves.
No. No way. I'm not being bait. Not this time.
A clever plan, but we don't have the manpower for a large-scale attack.
What should we do?
We need to make the Imperials believe we have more troops than we do.
If you draw them out with staged attacks at multiple locations, we can keep them occupied with hit-and-run tactics. There's minimal risk.
Then our doctor can sneak you in to the factory to find Darmas.
You want me to target specific locations, or should I just wander around taking pot shots?
Just tell me where to go.
I'm confused.
I'll mark the locations where you need to stage attacks. Once you draw enough Imperial troops out of the factory, you can go in and find Darmas.
Our men will hold their attention while you rendezvous with Doctor Shi Bata.
Who is this guy? How's he going to get me inside?
Can we trust this doctor?
Doctor Shi Bata. He's a medic for CorSec. His wife died in the Imperial attack. You can trust him.
I'll tell him to meet you at the triage station. He can sneak you in along with the Imperial wounded.
Enough Corellians are fighting with the Empire that you shouldn't draw immediate attention. Call me when you reach Darmas Pollaran.
Looks as if you did need some additional support.
Darmas got away. He's fled back to his Imperial masters.
Nevis Kitt, CorSec. Uh, sorry about that misunderstanding....
These aren't Imperial droids, they're local models. Councillor Caicos's factory.
Hurry. The Empire must not encroach on this sector.
Darmas seems to have hooked up with some rebel leader named Nevis Kitt. They're trying to blow open, uh, supply tunnel 26...?
Darmas ingratiated himself quickly, then. Nevis Kitt used to be a captain in CorSec, the Corellian police force.
Now he leads our fiercest squadron of guerilla defenders.
But to open supply tunnel 26... that is lunacy. It's sabotage; it's treachery piled on treason. Clearing the tunnel gives the Imperials a path straight to our hearts!
Why is this tunnel so important?
What's supply tunnel 26?
I never got the whole story--what are we trying to do on Corellia and what's happened so far?
Give me some background.
It has always been our quirk, that the Corellian council sells votes and takes bribes. But we believed them to have our best interests at heart.
The councillors sold Corellia to the Empire, never expecting the citizens to rebel.
But supply tunnel 26 is at the heart of the Red Light Sector. If Darmas Pollaran opens it, we could lose the ground it cost so many lives to take.
He's working with your rebels! Against the Empire! Why are you determined to believe the worst of him?
Darmas is trying to help!
He must be working with Nevis Kitt to undermine Corellia's defenses.
That's Darmas's plan.
The Selonian tunnel network is a labyrinth that connects the underside of every city on the planet.
Supply tunnel 26 is the main artery into what the humans call the "Red Light Sector." It cost many lives to block it so we could claim that ground.
We need to keep that tunnel sealed. The Red Light Sector's one of our only safe zones.
I'll talk to Darmas. He wouldn't do this.
It's all a misunderstanding.
If he agrees to turn Dodonna in, I will offer my apology.
Tell him that opening this tunnel only serves the Empire. Perhaps he will yet surprise us.
Let's show these Corellians the true face of Darmas Pollaran.
I'll unmask him.
If Darmas has the trust of Corellia's defenders, he can do great damage.
Never thought a beautiful Jedi would be asking me into a red light sector, but I'm happy to oblige.
[Flirt] I'll go stop Darmas.
From what Risha's said, you should know your way around.
Don't worry. That tunnel will stay sealed.
I'll go stop Darmas.
What else do we know?
Most of the Empire's heavy artillery should be on the far side of the tunnel. As long as it stays sealed.
Go now, and stop Nevis Kitt from carrying out this mad plan before the Imperials overrun us.
And bring Darmas back alive. His testimony is worth far more than his head.
This is a private facility... oh, Captain! Let me tell Master Sumalee you're here.
Captain, that dossier was incredible. Or all too credible, perhaps.
Unfortunately, Dodonna got wind of the arrest. She's fled to the Voidwolf.
Tell me someone's head is going to roll for this.
Who let her get away?
This may shock you, but the Jedi Order doesn't generally encourage decapitation.
Then why all the lightsabers?
No time to waste. Where's she heading?
Then we go after her.
We've traced her to the Museum of Alien History, which the Imperials are using as a POW camp. High Command doesn't want to go any further.
I know she was more than just your employer. Can I ask you to apprehend her now?
It's ironic that it took Dodonna's patronage to turn your loyalties to the Republic. Can I count on you now?
I can give you your reward for bringing in Darmas Pollaran, or triple it if you apprehend Senator Dodonna alive.
Part of the Selonian tunnel network runs under the museum. You're the only one who might be able to sneak in and find Dodonna.
I don't know where you people get this "I'm the only one" thing. I'm just a guy with a ship.
I'm not that special.
I'm getting tired of your "I'm the only one" thing. I'm just a girl who's quick on the draw.
I'm not that special.
Perhaps there is more to you than you realize.
Fine. Tell me about this museum.
Where do I go?
I can do better than that. I can give you a guide.
For a minute there, I thought you were going to ask me to lead an assault.
Sneaking's good.
We don't have the troops to assault the museum directly. Anyway, isn't this more your style?
Curske?
Impassable how? Imperial minefield? Poisonous gas? Man-eating alien tunnel-beasts?
What's the problem?
I take it you're a Selonian?
What kind of alien are you?
Once we're in, it's not abandoned anymore.
There's always a way in.
Captain, this is Curske. She's going to help you get into the museum.
Done. The captain loves blasting.
Good luck, Captain.
That's your problem now.
That tunnel's impassable. I told you that. It's been abandoned for centuries.
I can give you a map, but that's all. It's suicide. Those tunnels are old. The roofs have caved in. You would need to blast a path through the debris.
